intro: Osmoxylon insigne, commonly known as the noble osmoxylon, is a tropical plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its aromatic, resinous sap. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating. The flowers are small and inconspicuous, while the fruit is a capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature.
